items.title: The Iron Wall with Cracks
items.body: Since the Temple's destruction, an iron wall separates us from Hashem. But it's 'our wall'â€”we built it through sin. If we create cracks through a broken heart and teshuvah, the Ahavah Rabbah can shine through. Small cracks become lattices; larger openings become windows.

items.title: The Signet Seal
items.body: Letters exist first in thought, then are engraved on wax. The wax-letters are the same as the thought-letters, just in a different medium. So too, Torah in our world contains the exact same wisdom as in Heavenâ€”imprinted into physical stories and laws.

items.title: Aaron Kindling the Menorah
items.body: Just as Aaron lit the physical flames 'until they rose on their own,' spiritually he kindles the flame of Ahavah Rabbah in Jewish hearts. The soul's natural love is dormant; Aaron's influence awakens it to burn independently.

items.title: Water Reflecting Face
items.body: 'As water reflects face to face, so the heart of man to man.' Our spiritual effort below creates a reflection Above. The 'Kodesh' we achieve awakens the 'Hashem' to respondâ€”measure for measure, awakening for awakening.

items.content: Don't be satisfied with understanding. The goal is to awaken desire for Hashem Himselfâ€”not spiritual experiences or even Gan Eden. Tell yourself: 'Who do I have in Heaven? Besides You, I desire nothing.'

Watch for arroganceâ€”not just obvious pride, but the subtle sense of being 'someone.' Do you feel competitive? Offended? Unable to tolerate others' success? These are signs of spiritual Amalek. The antidote: 'What am I really before the Infinite?'
